briefdescription.para: Protect register write key mask.

Symbol indicating whether TAMPC external tamper switch detector is present.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Event to be cleared.

briefdescription.para: Function for retrieving the state of the TAMPC event.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Event to be checked.
The event has been generated.
The event has not been generated.

briefdescription.para: Function for getting the address of the specified TAMPC event register.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
The specified event.

simplesect.para: Address of the specified event register.

briefdescription.para: Function for enabling the specified interrupts.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Mask of interrupts to be enabled. Use nrf_tapmc_int_mask_t values for bit masking.

briefdescription.para: Function for disabling the specified interrupts.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Mask of interrupts to be disabled. Use nrf_tapmc_int_mask_t values for bit masking.

briefdescription.para: Function for checking if the specified interrupts are enabled.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Mask of interrupts to be checked. Use nrf_tapmc_int_mask_t values for bit masking.

briefdescription.para: Function for retrieving the state of pending interrupts.

simplesect.para: States of pending interrupt are saved as a bitmask. One set at particular position means that interrupt for event is pending.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.

simplesect.para: Bitmask with information about pending interrupts. Use nrf_tapmc_int_mask_t values for bit masking.

briefdescription.para: Function for getting the error detection status for given error detector.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Error detector for which the error status is to be retrieved.
Error detected.
No error detected.

briefdescription.para: Function for clearing the error detection status for given error detector.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Error detector for which the error status is to be cleared.

briefdescription.para: Function for enabling the specified active shield detector channels.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Mask of active shield detector channels to be enabled, constructed from nrf_tampc_activeshield_mask_t enumerator values.

briefdescription.para: Function for disabling the specified active shield detector channels.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Mask of active shield detector channels to be disabled, constructed from nrf_tampc_activeshield_mask_t enumerator values.

briefdescription.para: Function for checking if the specified active shield detector channels are enabled.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Mask of active shield detector channels to be checked, constructed from nrf_tampc_activeshield_mask_t enumerator values.

simplesect.para: Mask of enabled active shield detector channels.

memberdef.name: nrf_tampc_domain_ctrl_value_set

briefdescription.para: Function for setting signal value of the domain control register for given debug type and domain.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Debug type to be modified.
Domain for which the value is to be modified.
True if signal is to be logic 1, false if logic 0.

briefdescription.para: Function for getting the signal value of the domain control register for given debug type and domain.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Debug type to be retrieved.
Domain for which the value is to be retrieved.
Signal is logic 1.
Signal is logic 0.
